subject: Data
title: The First Weather Records
description: A quick, practical guide to The First Weather Records.

hook.text: In 1654, the Grand Duke of Tuscany built a network of weather stations across Europe.

buildup.text: Observers recorded temperature, pressure, and rainfall daily using standardized instruments.

discovery.text: This was the first systematic attempt to collect environmental data across multiple locations.

twist.text: The network collapsed after just a decade â€” political tensions killed Europe's first data project.

climax.text: But the idea survived. National weather services now collect billions of data points daily.

punchline.text: Forecasting the future started with writing down today.

quiz.question: Who organized Europe's first weather observation network?
